chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rollin P Rydlewicz

records.addlTxt: to vacate evidentiary hearing

9:50 AM Defendant Rollin P Rydlewicz in court.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Rollin P Rydlewicz.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Parties are prepared for trial.  Court reviews both parties MIL.  Parties request a Miranda Goodchild hearing.  Court reviews jury procedures for this courtroom.  There are no Daubert issues.  State comments on the jury instructions filed yesterday.  Defense to review the jury instruction.  Defense can file any proposed jury instructions in the next 48 hours.  The State anticipates the trial would run 1 day to 1 1/2 days.  Defense may call up to 4 witnesses.  Defense believes this would be completed by Thursday.  Parties ask for one alternate.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

NG plea entered.

9:47 AM Defendant Rollin P Rydlewicz in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Rollin P Rydlewicz.  Prosecuting attorney Barry Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Parties are prepared to go to contested preliminary hearing. 
State calls Investigator S. Diener, DSAT. Defense objects to reader. State responds. 
BTC: Objection overruled. 
Direct continues. Cross by Defense. No further witnesses for either party. 
State moves for bind over. 
Defense objects and gives statement. 
State responds. 
BTC: Court finds probable cause, matter bound over for to trial judge.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Rollin P Rydlewicz in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Henderson for Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Rollin P Rydlewicz.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense requests to reschedule for preliminary hearing next week.
BTC: Finding of good cause to waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: State's NOI to Use 911 Calls
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim T.R (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rollin P Rydlewicz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Rollin P Rydlewicz. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
